title: Rear Suspension Unit - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Raise and support the rear of the motorcycle under the engine. Position a block to support the rear wheel.
Engine Electronic Control Module (Engine ECM) - Removal
If closed, open the passenger right hand footrest to access the rear suspension preload adjuster fixings.
Note the routing of the preload adjuster hose and its retaining clip for installation.
There is a retaining band securing the adjuster hose to the suspension unit's body. There is no requirement to remove retaining band.
Release the fixings and detach rear suspension preload adjuster from the battery box.
Part of the main harness is routed near the rear suspension unit upper fixing.
Care must be taken not to damage the harness when removing or installing the rear suspension unit and its fixings.
Note the position of the harness between the battery box and rear suspension unit upper fixing for installation.
There is an access hole for access to the rear suspension upper flanged lock nut. It is located at the lower front right hand corner of the battery box.
Remove the flanged lock nut from the upper mounting bolt. Discard the flanged lock nut.
Battery box (rear subframe removed for clarity)
Note there is a sleeve fitted to the right hand outrigger for the suspension unit upper mounting bolt.
Remove the upper mounting bolt and sleeve.
Note there is a sleeve fitted to the right hand side of the drag link rocker for the suspension unit lower mounting bolt.
Remove the bolt securing the rear suspension unit to its lower mounting. Discard the flanged lock nut.
Manoeuvre the unit downwards and remove from the motorcycle.

search: Rear Suspension Unit - Removal
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Perform the following operations:
Seat - Removal
Battery - Removal
Fuel Tank - Removal
Right hand
Side Panels - Removal
Keyless ECM - Removal
Raise and support the rear of the motorcycle under the engine. Position a block to support the rear wheel.
Disconnect the engine ECM connectors (see
Engine Electronic Control Module (Engine ECM) - Removal
If closed, open the passenger right hand footrest to access the rear suspension preload adjuster fixings.
Note the routing of the preload adjuster hose and its retaining clip for installation.
There is a retaining band securing the adjuster hose to the suspension unit's body. There is no requirement to remove retaining band.
Release the fixings and detach rear suspension preload adjuster from the battery box.
Fixings
Preload adjuster
Retaining band
Rear suspension unit
Part of the main harness is routed near the rear suspension unit upper fixing.
Care must be taken not to damage the harness when removing or installing the rear suspension unit and its fixings.
Note the position of the harness between the battery box and rear suspension unit upper fixing for installation.
There is an access hole for access to the rear suspension upper flanged lock nut. It is located at the lower front right hand corner of the battery box.
Remove the flanged lock nut from the upper mounting bolt. Discard the flanged lock nut.
Battery box (rear subframe removed for clarity)
Harness
Flanged lock nut
Engine ECU connectors (2 off)
Note there is a sleeve fitted to the right hand outrigger for the suspension unit upper mounting bolt.
Remove the upper mounting bolt and sleeve.
Bolt
Sleeve
Note there is a sleeve fitted to the right hand side of the drag link rocker for the suspension unit lower mounting bolt.
Remove the bolt securing the rear suspension unit to its lower mounting. Discard the flanged lock nut.
Bolt
Sleeve
Manoeuvre the unit downwards and remove from the motorcycle.
